normalised: Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Your Guide to the Film Fest Circuit

unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever wondered what's brewing behind the scenes of the glitzy world of cinema? It's not all just big-budget Bollywood flicks and star-studded premieres. There's a whole other universe out there: Film Festivals!
normalised: Hey folks! Ever wondered what's brewing behind the scenes of the glitzy world of cinema? It's not all just big-budget Bollywood flicks and star-studded premieres. There's a whole other universe out there: Film Festivals!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as the cool indie cafes of the movie world, a place where you can discover hidden gems, connect with passionate filmmakers, and maybe even spot the next big thing before they blow up. From Cannes (okay, that’s not Indian, but still!) to closer home, like the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) held annually in Goa, these events are a celebration of cinematic artistry.
normalised: Think of film festivals as the cool indie cafes of the movie world, a place where you can discover hidden gems, connect with passionate filmmakers, and maybe even spot the next big thing before they blow up. From Cannes (okay, that’s not Indian, but still!) to closer home, like the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) held annually in Goa, these events are a celebration of cinematic artistry.

unnormalised: IFFI, by the way, is HUGE. Think week-long movie marathons, workshops with industry experts, and after-parties where you might just bump into a seasoned director or even a young, upcoming actor looking for their break. It's a total vibe.
normalised: I F F I, by the way, is HUGE. Think week-long movie marathons, workshops with industry experts, and after-parties where you might just bump into a seasoned director or even a young, upcoming actor looking for their break. It's a total vibe.

unnormalised: But film festivals aren't just for filmmakers, ya know? They’re awesome for movie buffs like you and me. You get to see films you'd probably never find in your local PVR, films that challenge perspectives, tell untold stories, and push the boundaries of filmmaking. Plus, imagine bragging to your friends that you saw that award-winning documentary months before it hit Netflix!

unnormalised: There are tons of smaller, more niche festivals too. For example, there might be one focusing on short films by students from FTII (Film and Television Institute of India) or even a regional festival highlighting filmmakers from the Northeast. Keep an eye out!
normalised: There are tons of smaller, more niche festivals too. For example, there might be one focusing on short films by students from F T I I (Film and Television Institute of India) or even a regional festival highlighting filmmakers from the Northeast. Keep an eye out!

unnormalised: So, how do you get involved? Check out websites that list film festivals, like FilmFreeway. Attend screenings (tickets are often surprisingly affordable!). Chat with filmmakers after their movies – they usually love talking about their work. And who knows, maybe you'll be inspired to pick up a camera and tell your own story!
